title: REVIEW: Party, Southampton University Students Union Theatre Group, Annex Theatre, Southampton University
text:
0 comments 
THIS one act play is by Tom Basden, who has had a hand as a writer and performer in recent TV comedy successes Fresh Meat, Plebs and The Wrong Mans , and it went on to form the basis of an amusing Radio 4 comedy show. 
So it seems a logical choice for a student production, that offers a nice opportunity for its cast and directors to cut their teeth. 
It works well enough, though the material is a little thin and obvious, its characters familiar types whose situation and relationships do not yet seem developed enough to fully engage. 
The greatest pleasure comes from seeing promising performers Alex Scatchbrook, Cat Lewis, Will Cook, Angry (short for Angharad) Morgan, Aidan Pittman and Jamie Martin growing in confidence, learning to time a laugh and hold an audienceâ€™s attention. Share article 
Pittman is particularly adept at straight faced foolishness, and Morgan adds value to her character, Phoebe. 
Ham Quentin REVIEW: Party, Southampton University Students Union Theatre Group, Annex Theatre, Southampton University
